contentText.text: Tom is asking Emma to provide him with addresses of Johnson Controls customers who are celebrities. Tom offers Emma a share of his profit if she can provide the addresses. What should Emma do?

optionContent.option: Make it to clear to Tom that she doesn’t want any payment, but still provide him with the list.
Decline to provide the list of addresses to Tom, but tell no one in case they think she’s involved.
Decline to provide the list of addresses to Tom, and report the situation to her manager.

incorrect.text: When Emma agrees to give Tom the addresses, she places them both at risk, even if she doesn’t accept a portion of his profits.

partial.text: Emma was right to refuse to provide Tom with the list of addresses, but she should recognize that even his request is problematic.
Emma should speak to her manager or a member of the Law department – if Tom continues to pursue this, it could create a privacy risk for the company.

correct.text: Emma did the right thing by refusing to provide Tom with the addresses and also reporting his request to her manager. If she had given Tom the information, she would have violated customer privacy. And, by speaking up she helped the company to prevent such an occurrence.
